content:
TITLE: Installing ggplot2 in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows three different ways to install ggplot2: as part of the tidyverse collection, as a standalone package, or the development version from GitHub using pak.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
# The easiest way to get ggplot2 is to install the whole tidyverse:
install.packages("tidyverse")

# Alternatively, install just ggplot2:
install.packages("ggplot2")

# Or the development version from GitHub:
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("tidyverse/ggplot2")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Customizing Position Guides with guide_axis()
DESCRIPTION: Function for customizing position guides with options like automatic removal of overlapping labels, rotation of axis labels, and arrangement of labels in multiple rows or columns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
guide_axis()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using sf with ggplot2 for Spatial Features
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use ggplot2 with sf package to create spatial visualizations. The example reads a shapefile and uses geom_sf() to plot it with area-based fill color.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE)
ggplot(nc) +
  geom_sf(aes(fill = AREA))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding by() Lists to ggplot Objects
DESCRIPTION: Function that allows lists created with the by() function to be added to ggplot objects, enabling easier plotting of grouped data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
ggplot_add.by()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Just Argument in geom_col and geom_bar
DESCRIPTION: Adds a new 'just' argument to geom_col() and geom_bar() for controlling column placement relative to axis breaks. Default is 0.5, with 0 and 1 aligning to left and right respectively.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
geom_col(just = 0) # Place columns on left of axis breaks
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Legend Layout in ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating different legend configurations in ggplot2, including default multi-row layout and single-column override using guide_legend()
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_46

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(displ,hwy, colour = model)) + geom_point()
p
p + theme(legend.position = "bottom")
# Previous behaviour
p + guides(colour = guide_legend(ncol = 1))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: New Axis Guide Usage in R ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Examples of using the new guide_axis functions including stack, theta and logticks guides. These allow for stacked axes, circular axes in radial coordinates, and logarithmic tick marks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
guides(theta = guide_axis_theta(...))
guides(x = guide_axis(position = "top"))
guide_axis(minor.ticks = TRUE)
guide_axis(cap = TRUE)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Custom Expansion Limits for Y Scale in R ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the expanded expand argument of scale_y_continuous() to control the spacing between plot elements and axes. This example sets the bottom of bars flush with the x-axis while leaving automatic expansion space at the top.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
ggplot(mtcars) +
    geom_bar(aes(x = factor(cyl))) +
    scale_y_continuous(expand = expand_scale(mult = c(0, .1)))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Secondary Axis in ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to set up a secondary axis with one-to-one transformation in ggplot2 scales. This allows displaying alternative units (like Celsius to Fahrenheit) on the opposite side of the plot.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_41

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
scale_x_continuous(sec.axis = sec_axis(~(. * 9/5) + 32))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using quo_name and quo_text for Tidy Evaluation in ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to handle tidy evaluation in ggplot2 post-version 2.2.1. This demonstrates using quo_name() and quo_text() to extract information from quosures, with a conditional check for backward compatibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_33

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
(packageVersion("ggplot2") <= "2.2.1")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Purrr-Style Lambda Notation in ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Demonstration of using purrr-style lambda notation in geom and stat functions, showing the new syntax support for specifying transformations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_32

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
ggplot(data) +
  geom_point(aes(x = ~var1, y = ~var2))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting geom_label with No Border in R
DESCRIPTION: Example of using geom_label() with label.size = 0 to produce labels without borders, which now correctly works in PDF output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_38

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
geom_label(label.size = 0)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using after_stat() for Aesthetic Evaluation Control
DESCRIPTION: Function that supersedes the use of stat() and ..var..-notation, allowing for finer control over the evaluation time of aesthetics in ggplot2 visualizations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
after_stat()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Continuous Scale Limits Function Example in R
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use functions for continuous scale limits to ensure limits are multiples of 100. This demonstrates the new capability to adjust scale limits dynamically based on default limits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_31

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
ggplot(data) + 
  scale_y_continuous(limits = function(lims) {
    # Round limits to nearest hundred
    c(floor(lims[1]/100) * 100, ceiling(lims[2]/100) * 100)
  })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Registering New Theme Elements in ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Function for extension package developers to define custom theme elements and integrate them into the ggplot2 element tree. This allows for extending the theming capabilities of ggplot2.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
register_theme_elements()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using dput() to Share R Data for Reproducible Examples
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the dput() function to generate reproducible R code for sharing datasets in bug reports. It shows the process of extracting and copying the mtcars dataset structure for inclusion in reproducible examples.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
dput(mtcars)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking Device Capabilities in R with ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: New function check_device() for testing the availability of advanced graphics features introduced in R 4.1.0 onward in ggplot2 version 3.5.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
check_device()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Layer Function with Data Function
DESCRIPTION: Example of using layer() with a function as the data argument, which transforms the input data before plotting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_43

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
ggplot() + 
  layer(data = function(data) { 
    # transform data
    transform(data)
  })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing ggplot Layout Object in R
DESCRIPTION: Exposes the Layout ggproto object through the $layout property of the ggplot object, allowing package developers to extend Layout behavior without rewriting ggplot_build.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
ggplot$layout
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using is.waiver Function in R
DESCRIPTION: Example of the newly exported is.waiver() helper function for working with waiver objects in ggplot2 extensions
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
is.waiver()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Function for Breaks in geom_contour
DESCRIPTION: Allows passing a function to the 'breaks' argument in geom_contour() for dynamic break calculation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
geom_contour(breaks = function(x) seq(min(x), max(x), by = 0.1))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling theme validation in R ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: The theme() function now has a 'validate' parameter to turn off validation, allowing storage of arbitrary additional data in themes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_50

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
theme(validate = FALSE)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic ggplot2 Usage Example with Scatter Plot
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic usage of ggplot2 by creating a scatter plot of the mpg dataset, mapping engine displacement to x-axis, highway miles per gallon to y-axis, and coloring points by car class.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, colour = class)) +
  geom_point()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Reproducible Dataset in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to properly include a dataset in a reproducible example by using the output from dput(). It demonstrates assigning the dput() output to a variable for use in the example code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
mtcars <- 
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Geom Customization in R ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Shows new customization options for various geoms including violin plots, boxplots, segments and labels.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
geom_violin(bounds = c(-Inf, Inf))
geom_boxplot(staplewidth = 0.5, outliers = FALSE)
geom_segment(x = 1, y = 1, xend = NULL, yend = 2)
geom_label(size.unit = "mm", label.padding = margin(1, 1, 1, 1, "mm"))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Built ggplot Objects in R
DESCRIPTION: New S3 method for ggplot_build() that returns input unaltered for <ggplot_built> classes in ggplot2 version 3.5.2.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
ggplot_build.ggplot_built <- function(plot) plot
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Retrieving Default Aesthetics in R with ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: New function get_geom_defaults() for retrieving resolved default aesthetics in ggplot2 version 3.5.2.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
get_geom_defaults()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Alt Text Generation in ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Tests the get_alt_text() function for generating automatic plot descriptions. Shows example output for a bar plot with class on x-axis and count on y-axis.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/labels.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
get_alt_text(p)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Missing Aesthetics Error in R ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Shows error message when required aesthetics (x and y) are missing from stat_sum(). The error clearly indicates which aesthetics are required but missing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/stats.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
ggplot_build(p)
Error in `stat_sum()`:
! Problem while computing stat.
i Error occurred in the 1st layer.
Caused by error in `compute_layer()`:
! `stat_sum()` requires the following missing aesthetics: x and y.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Default CRS in coord_sf
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set a default coordinate reference system in coord_sf() to interpret coordinates as longitude and latitude.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
default_crs = sf::st_crs(4326)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Break Generation for Numeric Scale Transforms in R
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the generation of breaks for various numeric scale transformations in ggplot2. It tests different transform functions with specific limits and outputs the resulting break values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/scales.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("asn", limits = c(0, 1))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("sqrt", limits = c(0, 10))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("atanh", limits = c(-0.9, 0.9))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks(transform_boxcox(0), limits = c(1, 10))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks(transform_modulus(0), c(-10, 10))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks(transform_yj(0), c(-10, 10))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("exp", c(-10, 10))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("identity", limits = c(-10, 10))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("log", limits = c(0.1, 1000))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("log10", limits = c(0.1, 1000))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("log2", limits = c(0.5, 32))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("log1p", limits = c(0, 10))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("pseudo_log", limits = c(-10, 10))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("logit", limits = c(0.001, 0.999))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("probit", limits = c(0.001, 0.999))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("reciprocal", limits = c(1, 10))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("reverse", limits = c(-10, 10))
```

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
test_breaks("sqrt", limits = c(0, 10))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Unknown Parameters and Aesthetics in ggplot2 (R)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how ggplot2 handles unknown parameters and aesthetics. It generates warnings for unknown parameters and aesthetics, as well as empty aesthetics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/layer.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
# unknown params create warning

Ignoring unknown parameters: `blah`

# unknown aesthetics create warning

Ignoring unknown aesthetics: blah

# empty aesthetics create warning

Ignoring empty aesthetics: `fill` and `shape`.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: After_scale() Function for Mapping to Scaled Aesthetic Values
DESCRIPTION: Function that allows mapping to already scaled aesthetic values, enabling more complex aesthetic transformations in ggplot2 visualizations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
after_scale()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Spatial Coordinate System Limits Validation
DESCRIPTION: Error handling for coordinate system limits in coord_sf() and validation of limit specifications. Includes suggestions for proper CRS configuration and limit format requirements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/coord_sf.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
Scale limits cannot be mapped onto spatial coordinates in `coord_sf()`.
i Consider setting `lims_method = "geometry_bbox"` or `default_crs = NULL`.
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
`xlim` must be a vector, not a <ScaleContinuousPosition> object.
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
`ylim` must be a vector of length 2, not length 3.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Error Message for Mismatched Aesthetic Lengths in ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: This error message is shown when the lengths of aesthetic mappings do not match the data length in ggplot2. It specifies which aesthetic mappings need to be fixed to match the data length.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/geom-.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Aesthetics must be either length 1 or the same as the data (4).
x Fix the following mappings: `d` and `e`.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using linewidth Aesthetic in ggplot2 Geoms
DESCRIPTION: Introduces the linewidth aesthetic to control line width in line-based geoms, superseding the size aesthetic for this purpose. Size now only affects point sizing in geoms with both lines and points.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
geom_line(aes(linewidth = variable))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Missing Y-axis Bounds Error in geom_ribbon() in R
DESCRIPTION: Error message displayed when neither ymin nor ymax aesthetics are provided to geom_ribbon(). At least one of these aesthetics must be specified for the function to work properly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/geom-ribbon.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
Problem while setting up geom.
i Error occurred in the 1st layer.
Caused by error in `setup_data()`:
! Either ymin or ymax must be given as an aesthetic.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting x-axis limits in R using lims() function
DESCRIPTION: The lims() function is introduced to easily set the limits of any axis in ggplot2. This snippet demonstrates how to set x-axis limits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_47

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
lims(x = c(0, 10))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting size and stroke for points in ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how size and stroke parameters work additively in geom_point(). A point with size=5 and stroke=5 will have a diameter of 10mm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_44

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
geom_point(size = 5, stroke = 5)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Alt-text Addition Example for ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to add accessibility alt-text to a ggplot2 plot using the labs function. This is a new feature that will support future integration with tools like Shiny and RMarkdown.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
+ labs(alt = ...)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Invalid date_minor_breaks Parameter in scale_x_date (R)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests the error handling when an invalid date_minor_breaks parameter (a numeric vector instead of a string) is passed to scale_x_date in ggplot2. It expects an error message.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/scale-date.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
ggplot_build(p + scale_x_date(date_minor_breaks = c(11, 12)))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Error Message for Invalid Aesthetic Modifier in ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: This error message is displayed when an invalid aesthetic modifier is used in a ggplot2 layer. It specifies the problematic aesthetic and suggests checking if the modifier is in the correct layer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/geom-.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Problem while setting up geom aesthetics.
i Error occurred in the 1st layer.
Caused by error:
! Aesthetic modifiers returned invalid values.
x The following aesthetics are invalid:
* `colour = after_scale(data)`
i Did you map the modifier in the wrong layer?
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting number of bins in R ggplot2 stat_bin() function
DESCRIPTION: The stat_bin() function now accepts a 'bins' argument to specify the number of bins directly, instead of using binwidth. This snippet demonstrates its usage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_49

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
stat_bin(bins = 100)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling Strip Clipping in ggplot2 Themes
DESCRIPTION: Introduces the 'strip.clip' argument in theme() to prevent clipping of strip text and background borders when set to "off".
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
theme(strip.clip = "off")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Numeric Input to Date Scale in ggplot2 (R)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet tests the behavior when a numeric value is passed to a Date scale in ggplot2. It expects a warning message indicating the conversion of the numeric value to a Date object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/scale-date.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
A <numeric> value was passed to a Date scale.
i The value was converted to a <Date> object.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: geom_bar Warning Message
DESCRIPTION: Standard warning message displayed by ggplot2 when geom_bar removes data points that fall outside the plot's scale range or contain missing values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/geom-bar.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range (`geom_bar()`).
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using stage() for Remapping Aesthetics
DESCRIPTION: Function that enables remapping of the same aesthetic multiple times in a plotting pipeline, such as mapping a data variable to a stat aesthetic and then remapping after statistical transformation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
stage()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Radial Coordinates in R with ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: New function coord_radial() as a successor to coord_polar() with more customization options in ggplot2 version 3.5.0.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
coord_radial(end = , donut = , rotate_angle = )
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deprecation Warnings for Old Syntax in ggplot2 (R)
DESCRIPTION: These snippets demonstrate the deprecation warnings issued when using older syntax in ggplot2. The 'stat(var)' and '..var..' notations are deprecated as of ggplot2 3.4.0, with 'after_stat(var)' being the recommended replacement.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/aes-calculated.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
`stat(foo)` was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
i Please use `after_stat(foo)` instead.
```

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
The dot-dot notation (`..bar..`) was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
i Please use `after_stat(bar)` instead.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Missing Aesthetic Error in stat_boxplot
DESCRIPTION: Shows the error message when stat_boxplot is called without required x or y aesthetics. The function fails during parameter setup with a clear error message about missing requirements.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/stat-boxplot.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
Problem while computing stat.
i Error occurred in the 1st layer.
Caused by error in `setup_params()`:
! `stat_boxplot()` requires an x or y aesthetic.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing combine_vars() Function with Missing Variables in R
DESCRIPTION: Tests error handling in combine_vars() function when dealing with undefined faceting variables
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/facet-.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
combine_vars(list(df), vars = vars(letter = letter))
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Validating Layer Inputs in ggplot2 (R)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates various input validations for the layer() function in ggplot2. It checks that geom, stat, and position are either strings or appropriate objects, and that mapping is created by aes().
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/layer.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

TITLE: Extracting Aesthetics from ggplot2 Layer in R
DESCRIPTION: This function extracts the aesthetics from a ggplot2 layer object. It combines the default aesthetics with the user-specified aesthetics, giving priority to user specifications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/revdep/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
layer_aes <- function(layer) {
  # Set up aesthetic mappings
  if (is.null(layer$mapping)) {
    aesthetics <- layer$stat$default_aes
  } else {
    aesthetics <- defaults(layer$mapping, layer$stat$default_aes)
  }

  # Check that mappings are compatable length: either 1 or the same length
  # as the data
  lengths <- vapply(aesthetics, length, integer(1))
  unequal <- lengths != 1 & lengths != nrow(layer$data)
  if (any(unequal)) {
    bad <- names(aesthetics)[unequal]
    details <- paste(bad, "(length ", lengths[unequal], ")", sep = "", collapse = ", ")
    stop("Aesthetics must either be length one, or the same length as the data.",
         "Problems: ", details, call. = FALSE)
  }

  # Set aesthetics from parameters
  if (is.null(layer$geom_params)) {
    set <- NULL
  } else {
    set <- intersect(names(layer$geom_params), names(layer$geom$aesthetics()))
  }
  for (nm in set) {
    aesthetics[[nm]] <- layer$geom_params[[nm]]
  }

  # Override mappings with atomic parameters
  if (is.null(layer$aes_params)) {
    layer$aes_params <- list()
  }
  for (nm in names(layer$aes_params)) {
    aesthetics[[nm]] <- layer$aes_params[[nm]]
  }

  aesthetics
}
```

TITLE: Flattening Nested Lists in R for ggplot2
DESCRIPTION: This function recursively flattens nested lists, removing NULL values and empty lists. It's used internally by ggplot2 to process complex aesthetic mappings and other nested data structures.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2/blob/main/revdep/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
ggplot_build <- function(plot) {
  plot <- plot_clone(plot)
  if (length(plot$layers) == 0) {
    stop("No layers in plot", call. = FALSE)
  }

  layers <- plot$layers
  layer_data <- lapply(layers, function(y) y$layer_data(plot$data))

  scales <- plot$scales
  # Apply function to layer and matching data
  by_layer <- function(f) {
    out <- vector("list", length(layers))
    for (i in seq_along(layers)) {
      out[[i]] <- f(layers[[i]], layer_data[[i]])
    }
    out
  }

  # Compute aesthetics to produce data with generalised variable names
  data <- by_layer(function(l, d) l$compute_aesthetics(d, plot))

  # Transform all scales
  data <- lapply(data, scales_transform_df, scales = scales)

  # Map and train positions so that statistics have access to x and y
  # dimensions
  layout <- create_layout(plot$facet, plot$coordinates)
  data <- layout$setup(data, plot$data, plot$plot_env)

  # Apply and map statistics
  data <- by_layer(function(l, d) l$compute_statistic(d, layout))
  data <- by_layer(function(l, d) l$map_statistic(d, plot))

  # Make sure missing (but required) aesthetics are added
  scales_add_missing(plot, c("x", "y"), plot$plot_env)

  # Reparameterise geoms from (e.g.) y and width to ymin and ymax
  data <- by_layer(function(l, d) l$compute_geom_1(d))

  # Apply position adjustments
  data <- by_layer(function(l, d) l$compute_position(d, layout))

  # Reset position scales, then re-train and map.  This ensures that facets
  # have control over the range of a plot: is it generated from what's
  # displayed, or does it include the range of underlying data
  reset_scales(plot)
  layout$train_position(data, scales_x(), scales_y())
  layout$reset_scales()

  # Train and map non-position scales
  npscales <- scales_x(position = "free") ++ scales_y(position = "free")
  if (npscales$n() > 0) {
    lapply(data, scales_train_df, scales = npscales)
    data <- lapply(data, scales_map_df, scales = npscales)
  }

  # Fill in defaults etc.
  data <- by_layer(function(l, d) l$compute_geom_2(d))

  # Let layer stat have a final say before rendering
  data <- by_layer(function(l, d) l$finish_statistics(d))

  structure(
    list(
      data = data,
      layout = layout,
      plot = plot
    ),
    class = "ggplot_built"
  )
}
```


LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
# new
setNames(list(scale$map(breaks)), aesthetic %||% scale$aesthetics[1])
```
